g.text: TEs do not show increased non-CG methylation, but rather decreased average CHG and

, as well as to increased DRM2-mediated RdDM associated with increased

mutants revealed no significant variation, apart from a slight increase
Therefore, it is likely that the alterations in non-CG
mechanisms. Making the analogy with other plant systems, we propose that at least part of the
involves a RdDM-like pathway since it affects both CHG
and CHH sites. Hence, our data suggest that CG methylation (and/or Mp
shows a specific feature of DNA methylation of CHG and CHH subcontext.
, tomato, maize and rice, CCG methylation is 20-50% lower than CAG/CTG

. However, our results indicate the regulation of CHG methylation in
likely involves distinct/unique molecular mechanisms. Indeed, while methylation
